alert.note: Alert for Central Aleutians (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Wind Watch issued February 19 at 3:48PM AKST until February 21 at 9:00AM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WATCH IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY EVENING THROUGH TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Southwest winds 40 to 55 mph with gusts up to 75 mph possible. * WHERE...Central Aleutians. * WHEN...From Monday evening through Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...High winds could move loose debris, damage property, and cause power outages. Travel could be difficult. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A strong low pressure system is expected to lift out of the North Pacific and into the western Bering on Monday. The leading frontal boundary will bring increasing southerly winds and heavy precipitation Monday afternoon. Stronger winds are expected Monday night through early Tuesday morning as the wind direction shifts to the west-southwest. Precipitation will initially start as wet snow Monday morning before quickly changing to rain in the afternoon. Conditions are expected to improve by Tuesday afternoon as the low lifts northward.
info.instruction: A high wind watch means there is potential for a hazardous high wind event. Monitor the latest forecasts and warnings for updates on this situation. Fasten loose objects or shelter objects in a safe location prior to the onset of winds.
